instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01949: What is 820-01949? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.CD3217: What is CD3217? This is a USB-C muxing chip responsible for USB-C communication with devices such as the laptop charger. The most common issue this chip is involved in is when a Macbook wonâ€™t charge or the charger is stuck at 5v instead of going to 20v..
definitions.PP3V3_G3H_RTC: What is PP3V3_G3H_RTC? PP3V3_G3H_RTC Is one of the first rails that has to come on in order for the USB-C mux chip to be powered in the T2 chip Macbook Pros..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01949</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
this arrived with liquid damage in the <CHIP>U3100</CHIP> area. Before working on the board it has 20v with low amp draw but did not power on. Replaced resistors and <CHIP>U3100</CHIP> since liquid was under <CHIP>U3100</CHIP>. Stuck at 5v now with amp meter cycling every few seconds on this port. Using a known good <CHIP>CD3217</CHIP>. All traces and resistors in area look good. LDO voltages are good.

What should be checked next?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01949</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
Usually, input voltage cycles when the board tries to start.
Check diode mode to ground on all big coils.
Also check if starts in SMC bypass mode.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01949</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01949</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message: does not start in SMC bypass

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01949</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
Looks to have short to ground there.
I don't have comparison board, but I don't see a good reason for such low value.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01949</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
Replaced <TRANSISTOR>Q8100</TRANSISTOR> with no change. Injected 1v before but nothing got warm

On a known good board the value is 0.008

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01949</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message: What should be checked next? Shouldn't the issue with meter cycling on the one port be addressed first?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01949</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
Only one port stuck on 5V?
What happens on other port?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01949</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message: All ports are stuck at 5v. <CHIP>U3100</CHIP> port has meter cycling turns on and off every few seconds even with a known good <CHIP>CD3217</CHIP>

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01949</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
The problem may be on the other ports.
<CHIP>U3100</CHIP> port may cycle because the board tries to start there.
But strange, if you had 20V before touching the board.

The heat might affected something on the board, or moved components.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01949</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
Can you advise on what to check or try next?

Have a good board besides this one and all components are present. The only diode measurement that is off is <SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H_RTC</SIGNAL> good board is around .350 but only 0.085 on this board but cannot be a short since 3.3V is still  present

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01949</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
No short, but is very low value.
This may point to bad chip, or filter cap.
The problem is there are many chips and caps connected...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01949</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
When injecting 3v nothing got warm. Can this low value be the issue even though 3.3v is present?

What should be removed first?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01949</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
Lower value than normal, but too high for voltage injection method.
In this case, should start with the chips which generate voltage for the areas affected by liquid.
Is more or less question of luck...
